data.title: Hospitality from the heart
data.meta_description: Discover our locations Our family of Inns are spread across England and Wales at the heart of some of the best market towns. Scroll down to see our regions.
data.meta_site_name: The Coaching Inn Group - Hospitality from the heart
data.text:
The Moorland Hotel | Dartmoor, Devon

The Moorland Hotel is in the heart of Dartmoor National Park and surrounded by the tranquility of nature. Free roaming cows, sheep and horses explore the 11 acres of greens surrounding The Moorland Hotel, so you can sit back and relax in the wondrous countryside. Timeless rock structures are dotted throughout the hills, perfect if you want to do some exploring of your own.

Whether you are looking for a welcoming place to spend the night or would simply like to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat surrounded by friendly faces, The Moorland Hotel is perfectly placed, right in the centre of the picturesque National Park. It has its own car park, offers all-day dining, teas and coffees, free WiFi and is pet-friendly.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Pheasant Hotel | Holt, Norfolk

The hotel is perfectly placed to explore the North Norfolk Coast, whether for birdwatching, walking the coastal path, playing golf, visiting stately homes and gardens, riding the North Norfolk Steam Railway or shopping. The Pheasant creates a friendly, relaxing environment where guests can enjoy a great stay, with good food and welcoming service.

Dining is either in the AA rosetted à la carte restaurant, with capacity for 100, or in the more relaxed recently opened Orangery.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Talbot Hotel | Malton, North Yorkshire

The Talbot is a beautiful seventeenth century riverside coaching inn set in the award winning foodie town of Malton, Yorkshire. Really we’re a restaurant with 26 cosy rooms and food at the heart of everything we do.

Close to the North York Moors and stunning coastline, expect a warm Yorkshire welcome with roaring fires & lots of cosy corners. The Talbot is relaxed and rustic: come in your wellies, bring the dog and enjoy a perfect Sunday roast or a pint of local beer.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Manor Coastal Hotel & Inn | Blakeney, Norfolk

Whatever the season, it’s always a good time to visit Norfolk – there is just so much to do. With our super location close to the village centre and the quay, The Manor Coastal Hotel & Inn, Blakeney offers a great base for nature lovers and walkers. Within a few steps you can be on the coastal path, gillying on the quay or boarding a boat to see the grey seals at Blakeney Point.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Royal Wells Hotel, Tunbridge Wells | Tunbridge Wells

The Royal Wells Hotel in Tunbridge Wells, is in the perfect location, situated in the centre of Royal Tunbridge Wells, Kent, and a stones throw from High Weald Area of Outstanding Natural Beauty.

The hotel owes its regal title to Queen Victoria, who visited the Royal Wells often as a young Princess in the early 19th century. She later granted the use of her coat of arms, which is proudly displayed at the top of the building. It has recently undergone an extensive refurbishment, incorporating the latest facilities and contemporary style, while retaining the original Victorian elegance and period features.

So, whether visiting for business or pleasure, take time out to discover why the Royal Wells Hotel is your ideal getaway destination.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Swan Hotel | Wells, Somerset

The Swan Hotel has a fantastic location in the city of Wells, being right in the centre with plenty of shops and places to visit. For 600 years they have had many guests enjoy this wonderful inn, with a few famous faces too. The Cathedral is directly opposite the hotel and you can admire its magnificence from our outside seating area, directly leading into the Cathedral gardens. For film buffs, this hotel also had various scenes filmed here for the well known Simon Pegg film ‘Hot Fuzz’.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Tudor House Hotel | Tewkesbury, Gloucestershire

With a rich and vibrant history, the riverside town of Tewkesbury boasts stunning scenery, including almost 400 listed buildings and an elegant 900 year old Abbey. A stroll down the charming streets can take you back to an age when half-timbered houses were crammed into any available space and Tewkesbury’s famous alleyways were developed.

The Tudor House Hotel dates back to 1546 and is one of the most distinctive buildings on the high street. Step inside into our Eatery & Coffee House and relax in variety of settings where you can enjoy a meal from breakfast to dinner, coffee or afternoon tea. Need to rest your head? One of our beautiful 25 bedrooms is the perfect place to retire to after a day of exploring everything the Cotswolds has to offer.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Kings Arms & Royal | Godalming, Surrey

The Kings Arms and Royal Hotel is a coaching inn conveniently located on Godalming High Street with a long history, including parts of the building that dates back to as far as the 1300s!

After undergoing a full refurbishment in early 2022, The King’s Arms & Royal is now one of the best hotels in Godalming, Surrey. With 21 highly appointed and stylish bedrooms, a large open plan restaurant & bar and a courtyard to relax in on those warmer days, our friendly and knowledgeable team cannot wait to welcome you ‘Inn’.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Wynnstay Hotel | Oswestry, Shropshire

Located in the Shropshire market town of Oswestry, The Wynnstay Hotel boasts 32 bedrooms, a large function suite, a restaurant and two bars serving traditional British and continental dishes, all surrounding the historic crown bowling green.

Once a well-known coaching inn, The Wynnstay Hotel has been an important part of the town of Oswestry since 1727. The perfect resting place for those travelling between Liverpool and Cardiff or London and Holyhead, The Wynnstay has also welcomed a number of esteemed guests, including a young Queen Victoria.

The impressive facade is a fine example of typical Georgian architecture and the building has been sympathetically restored and renovated during an extensive refurbishment programme in 2022. The old coaching house has been converted into a modern gym, whilst a former grocers has been transformed into the contemporary Wilsons Coffee House & private event venue. The gym is accessible for our hotel residents, however it is managed independently from the hotel.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The George Hotel | Dorchester-on-Thames, Oxfordshire

The George combines the beauty of a historic building complete with original oak beams and inglenook fireplaces, with all the advantageous of a modern hotel. The George is a striking, idyllic 15th-century coaching inn set in bustling Dorchester-on-Thames, opposite the famous Dorchester Abbey and museum.

The George is an historic 15th Century coaching inn built in 1495 complete with oak beams and inglenook fireplaces and situated in this historic village opposite Dorchester Abbey and museum. The Inn has often been used for TV such as Midsomer Murders & Miss Marple.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Crown Hotel | Boroughbridge, North Yorkshire

The Crown Hotel is centrally located in the Yorkshire market town of Boroughbridge. Midway between London and Edinburgh, just off the A1, this delightful hotel is blessed with convenience as well as history and character!

A charming old coaching inn, the hotel is steeped in history, full of friendliness and boasts all the facilities you'll need to enjoy a relaxing break. We genuinely care about putting a smile on your face, so we'll meet, greet and serve you with one on ours.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Rutland Arms Hotel | Bakewell, Peak District

Perfect for those looking to explore the sights and sounds of the area as it lies equidistant from the beautiful towns of Matlock and Buxton and the Rutland Arms Hotel itself is nestled comfortably on the outskirts of the famous Chatsworth estate. The Rutland Arms Hotel dates back to 1804 and is set in the majestic Peak District National Park in the picturesque town of Bakewell.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Castle Hotel | Conwy, North Wales

Conwy is a town rich in history, with much of it still preserved within the walls and traditional structures of its buildings. In the heart of it is the mighty 13th-century castle, whose walls encapsulate this remarkable medieval town.

The Castle Hotel is an old coaching inn in Wales, standing on the site of a Cistercian abbey within the UNESCO World Heritage walled town of Conwy.

This popular Hotel in Wales offers individually designed accommodation. The hotel has 29 bedrooms to the AA and Visit Wales’ exacting 4 Star Town House standards with a ’boutique’ feel.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The White Hart Royal Hotel | Moreton in Marsh, Cotswolds

The White Hart Royal Hotel is conveniently located in the market town of Moreton-in-Marsh at the head of the beautiful Evenlode Valley in the English Cotswolds.

The hotel was and still is a great coaching inn. Its reputation was enhanced when King Charles I sheltered in the inn following the battle of Marston Moor on 2nd July 1644. A copy of the King’s unpaid bill is commemorated on a plaque within the entrance lobby.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Golden Fleece Hotel | Thirsk, North Yorkshire

The Golden Fleece, on Thirsk’s cobbled market place is situated between the North Yorkshire Moors and The Yorkshire Dales National Parks. The hotel was once a famous coaching inn and is steeped in history, it’s Georgian “coaching clock“ still hangs in the entrance hall. Our 26 en-suite rooms are individually designed to make guests feel completely at home, service is relaxed and friendly. We have our own private car park and wifi access is free of charge. Whether you are attending a conference, wedding or social event or simply getting away from it all we offer all our guests a warm Yorkshire welcome.

Thirsk is home to the award winning James Herriot centre and for racing enthusiasts there are courses in Thirsk, York, Ripon, and Catterick. The hotel is well placed for visiting the best that Yorkshire has to offer from the ancient city of York, with its winding streets and Minster, to the North Yorkshire Dales and Moors and the historic coastal town of Whitby. Markets are held on the market square every Monday and Saturday.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Bell Inn | Stilton, Cambridgeshire

The most central hotel in Stilton and a great place to enjoy a break as far as ideal locations go, hotels in Stilton don’t get much better situated than The Bell Inn; the most central and iconic hotel in this delightful historic village. Welcoming overnight guests and day visitors for over 500 years, The Bell is full of old-world charm and character but has carefully balanced it with modern day comforts for an exceptionally enjoyable stay.

The Bell Inn dates back to 1500 (though its origins could be even earlier, as there is a record of a local innkeeper in 1437). From 1500 to 1515 Edward Tebald and his wife Alice owned the Bell. We know that their daughter Margaret and her husband William Redehede sued her parent’s tenant for possession, but little else from those early days.

Today’s building dates from 1642, the date marked on the southern gable, and the year in which the Civil War began. It was originally built of oolitic limestone and slates of Colleyweston stone.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Kings Head Hotel | Richmond, North Yorkshire

Built as a gentleman’s townhouse in 1717 The Kings Head’s fine Georgian architecture blends with modern practicalities to give warm and comfortable surroundings and a relaxed ambience.

The rooms to the front of the hotel are typically large and many of the building’s Georgian features have been retained including the ballroom where Franz Liszt gave a piano recital in 1841.

Richmond itself with its wynds and streets offers many attractions including a Norman castle an imposing sight above the banks of the river Swale and the ruins of Easby Abbey.

Richmond has many beautiful walks including riverside, woodland and the remains of the Georgian racecourse.

Catterick racecourse and Croft Motor racing circuit are nearby and a further 7 racecourses are within an hour’s drive from the Kings head making it a perfect base for leisure visits.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Talbot Hotel | Oundle, Northamptonshire

The hotel originally dates from the 7th Century AD and its oldest building is clearly medieval in design albeit with a modified 16th century gallery, complete with original graffiti dating back to the 1700s etched into its windows. The hotel is famous for its New Street and inner courtyard facades, which were built with stone from Fotheringhay Castle in 1630. The stone mullion windows and timber staircase overlooking the inner courtyard are reputedly, also from Fotheringhay Castle. The staircase is believed to be that which Mary Queen of Scots famously descended on route to her execution at the castle on 8 February 1587.

The Eatery at the Talbot is so named because it offers a comprehensive but not overwhelming, menu available not only in the main garden restaurant, in the bar or School room but is also available alfresco in the courtyard or garden. The restaurant has one AA Rosette for an experience “that stands out in its local area“.

The Coffee House, with its fully stocked patisserie unit, offers a true high street coffee experience. The difference is the period ambience as you take a sofa in the glass house or a seat on one of our varied internal and external areas.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

Jamaica Inn | Bodmin, Cornwall

Whilst the character and charm of the old parts of the Inn - the olde worlde bars, some restaurant areas and the ‘old rooms’ 3 to 12 - have been carefully preserved, Jamaica Inn had a new wing recently built that provides contrastingly modern bedrooms with breath-taking views over the moor. In total there are now 36 bedrooms and suites. The Inn also has a Smuggling Museum full of artefacts where tales of Cornish smugglers, wreckers and villains are brought wonderfully to life in a short film available to see in the museum. Its Daphne du Maurier Museum has many recently acquired exhibits including the original letters to Daphne and her husband from the Queen, Prince Philip, Prince Charles, Lord Mountbatten and others.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The King William IV Country Pub & Hotel | Sedgeford, North Norfolk

The King William IV Country Pub & Hotel in Sedgeford is ideally situated amidst the picturesque charm of its surroundings. Nestled in the heart of the village, the establishment offers enchanting views of the scenic landscapes, creating a serene atmosphere for guests to relish.

This charming country pub and hotel have undergone thoughtful renovations, preserving its historical character. The Courtyard Bar, Eatery & Coffee House is a delightful space where guests can indulge in casual brunches, lunches, afternoon teas, or dinners. The inviting ambiance makes it an ideal spot to unwind and savor a range of delectable offerings.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Saracens Head Hotel | Great Dunmow, Essex

Nestled in the heart of the charming market town of Great Dunmow, Essex, the Saracens Head Hotel stands as a beacon of hospitality, offering a delightful retreat for locals and visitors alike. With a prime location, this historic establishment provides a relaxing setting for a stay in Essex.

For those seeking a more refined dining experience, our Restaurant awaits, offering an elegant setting to indulge in some of the finest cuisine the area has to offer. The menu, curated with precision and passion, showcases a symphony of flavours that will tantalize your taste buds and leave a lasting impression.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Three Swans Hotel | Market Harborough, Leicestershire

For over 500 years, Market Harborough’s The Three Swans Hotel has offered a warm welcome to guests, travellers and diners. As a coaching inn, it dates back to as early as 1517 when it was known simply as ‘Ye Signe of Swanne’. Many famous guests such as King Charles I and Queen Anne have been welcomed through its doors.

The 16th century building property blends traditional hospitality with the comfort of a modern hotel and has been providing excellent food, drink and warm hospitality for over 500 hundred years. The hotel is perfectly placed in the centre of the historic market town of Market Harborough and has it’s own large residents car park. There are easy links to local motorways and major road networks and it is close to the town’s railway station which has mainline services to London and the North.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Royal Oak Hotel | Welshpool, Mid Wales

The Royal Oak Hotel is a Grade II listed building which began its life in the 18th century, however parts of it are much older. There is a chimney stack in the hotel which features stone from an abbey that once stood in Pool Quay in Elizabethan times.

Originally The hotel lay in the grounds of nearby Powis Castle. During its existence for centuries this grandiose Georgian building has welcomed many travellers through its doors. During our time as a coaching inn on the main route to the welsh coast of Wales, the Hotel saw its current function suite used as a stables with its own Ostler (someone who looks after horses). Notably, in 2010, The Royal Oak Hotel pleasure of welcoming one of the most prestigious guests from anywhere in the world, Her Majesty the Queen, when she visited Welshpool to open its new indoor cattle market and to have lunch at The Royal Oak Hotel.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Three Swans Hotel | Hungerford, Berkshire

A traditional and historic coaching inn. While it has been altered over the years to reflect changing tastes, The Three Swans still retains the original archway through which carriages once used to enter the courtyard.

Situated in the beautiful Kennet Valley, Hungerford is ideally located for exploration of an area of unspoiled natural rural charm, steeped in history and myth, with bustling market towns, beautiful country homes and ancient landmark symbols such as the White Horse, Silbury Hill and Avebury Stone Circle.

Just 3 miles from the M4 (J14) and with excellent rail links, the town of Hungerford boasts a famous and extraordinary range of antique shops, courtyards and arcades. Newbury, home to the famous racecourse is only 8 miles away.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Swan Hotel | Stafford, Staffordshire

The Swan has sat in it’s position from the 1700’s, with reports of part of the hotel being used as a college for St. Mary’s Church, dating back to the early 1600’s. Following extensive refurbishments and renovations throughout it’s life as a hotel, The Swan is now a highly reputable hotel, and, with it’s key location on Greengate Street, offers patrons the chance to put their bags down and enjoy a relaxing and refreshing drink.

Whether you are looking for a welcoming place to spend the night or would simply like to enjoy a drink or a bite to eat surrounded by friendly faces, The Swan is perfectly placed, right in the centre of the historic town of Stafford. It has its own large car park, offers all-day dining and an in-house coffee shop, along with free WiFi.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The White Hart Hotel | Boston, Lincolnshire

The White Hart Hotel is conveniently located in the centre of the bustling market town of Boston, Lincolnshire. With its stunning riverside location it enjoys great views of the Boston Stump, which is the local name for the historic 700 year old St Botolphs Church, which is the largest Parish Church in England.

The hotel offers a mix of 26 classic, superior and deluxe en-suite bedrooms. Enjoy the Riverside Restaurant for evening dining, and the relaxed setting of the Courtyard Bar for brunch, lunch, afternoon tea and evening dining. The hotel has lovely sofa areas for you to sit, relax and unwind and enjoy a drink from the wide selection of fine wines, beers, spirits and soft drinks on offer.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Admiral Rodney Hotel | Horncastle, Lincolnshire

Located in the attractive Lincolnshire market town of Horncastle, the Admiral Rodney Hotel is midway between the Cathedral City of Lincoln and the East Coast seaside resorts. On the southern tip of the beautiful Lincolnshire Wolds, there are many places to go and things to do and see in the area.

In addition to the many antique shops in Horncastle, there are a wide variety of other attractions including Cadwell Park Racing Circuit and Battle of Britain Memorial Flight Visitors Centre at RAF Coningsby.

Originally a coaching inn first mentioned in the seventeenth century, it has been the subject of a major refurbishment and redevelopment scheme and now offers international standards of accommodation, comfort and cuisine in its range of stylish 31 en-suite bedrooms, restaurant & bars. Whether it is for a business meeting or conference, seminar, private dinner, banquet or wedding, or simply a relaxing weekend, you can be confident that the friendly, professional and helpful staff of the Admiral Rodney Hotel will help to ensure that your stay is both pleasurable and memorable – every time.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

The Old Bridge Inn | Holmfirth, West Yorkshire

The historic Old Bridge Inn and Coffee House, famed for the warmth of its traditional Yorkshire hospitality, sits imposingly by the side of the River Holme in the centre of the small market town of Holmfirth.

Adjacent to the Peak District National Park, the town lies amongst the stunning natural beauty of the Pennine hills with the famous Pennine Way cutting across the adjoining heather-covered moors.

Although surrounded by such natural beauty, the Hotel is only a short drive from the major towns and cities of Manchester, Leeds, Sheffield, Bradford and Wakefield – making it an ideal venue for a relaxing week or weekend break, an important business meeting or conference.

Holmfirth is renowned as the location for the hugely popular television series Last of the Summer Wine and over the years the Hotel has been delighted to entertain famous members of the cast and production team as guests.

View Website BOOK A ROOM Contact Us

Castle Of Brecon | Brecon, Wales

The oldest hotel in Wales, The Castle of Brecon is a charming country house in a tranquil location, with stunning riverside and mountain views. Full of character, the rooms at Brecon Castle are equipped with everything you need for a cosy stay in Brecon. The restaurant serves delicious food, local ales and ciders, and there is a riverside terrace.
